{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3504582,"name":null,"username":"Destruct07","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/bc79bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-07T01:06:31.688Z","cooked":"

When testing our batteries with West Mountain Radio CBAV we tested using the recommended amperage of 3.6 amps. However, the results indicate the battery should last 2-3 times longer than they actually do. What amperage should we test our batteries at or is there something wrong with our battery/testing system?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-02-07T01:06:31.688Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":23,"reads":174,"readers_count":173,"score":154.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":485494,"topic_slug":"how-many-amps-should-i-test-battery-s-at","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70109,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4453 Cad & Mechanical"},"post_url":"/t/how-many-amps-should-i-test-battery-s-at/485494/1","custom_user_title":"4453 Cad & Mechanical","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3504606,"name":"JBENJI","username":"JBENJI","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c6cbf5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-07T01:32:29.256Z","cooked":"

We test at a constant 7.5 amps, and test to a cutoff of 10.5 volts.

AndyMark has a better description of how to test -

andymark.com

Computerized Battery Analyzer

The computerized Battery Analyzer is much more than a simple battery voltage tester or a battery load tester. It will test virtually any type or size of battery, any chemistry or number of cells, up to 55 volts. We are making this tester available...

Destruct07:

the results indicate the battery should last 2-3 times longer than they actually do.

How are you calculating expected battery life, and how are you measuring actual battery life?
